Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Comprehensive Guide to Xero Accounting
headline: Learn how to use Xero’s cloud-based accounting software to manage your business’ finances in this free online course.
description: If you want to begin a career in accounting or bookkeeping, this Xero accounting tutorial offers a good starting point as the software is ideal for small and medium-sized businesses because of its cloud-based functions and ability to allocate resources and fulfil other vital financial obligations. We go through the essentials of Xero and explain features like its balance sheet, chart of accounts, VAT and CIS return and bank reconciliation.
courseDescription:
Do you want to take control of your business’ finances? Xero accounting software is popular worldwide as it offers small to medium companies reliable bookkeeping and financial planning capabilities. It is hosted in the cloud and simplifies the process of managing payroll and meeting your fiduciary responsibilities to stakeholders.

This course is designed primarily for students with no prior expertise in accounting and offers training broken down into manageable segments. We cover the fundamental aspects of Xero and explain how to use the software to perform a wide range of accounting activities, including adjusting the nominal ledger, completing a VAT return, reconciling the bank and more.

After completing this training and receiving the relevant certification, you will be able to use the business accounting features of Xero like a true professional, either as a financial accountant, bookkeeping assistant, business administrator or even an accounts assistant. We offer the most in-demand accounting skills taught by people at the top of their fields. Sign up to learn how to use Xero’s cloud-based accounting software and its many features to handle your finances and simplify bookkeeping.

Start Course Now

Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:

  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

  • Lesson Summary

    • Xero is a cloud-based accounting programme made specifically for small businesses.
    • You can start using Xero once you've added your organisation, but check your finance and company settings beforehand.
    • Xero offers conventional and innovative invoicing.
    • If you use standard payment conditions, include them in your invoice settings so that they display on every invoice you send. You can also add your company logo and modify our invoice templates.
    • Set up a payment facility so clients may pay you right from the invoice.
    • You must examine your bank statement and Xero ledger to reconcile your account.
    • Bank feeds connect your bank to Xero. Bank feeds automatically import bank statements into Xero so you can match statement lines to transactions. It helps you track incoming and outgoing capital.
    • Add an authorised or invoiced purchase request to a new bill to pay a supplier for supplies received.
    • Xero prepares one draft bill for each supplier from copied purchase orders.
    • Configure your suppliers to make sales orders to match products and services to a job.
    • Create contacts for each supplier, search by name, address, or phone number, or filter by the supplier's first letter.

  • Lesson Summary

    • You can start using Xero once you've added your organisation, but check your finance and company settings beforehand.
    • Xero offers conventional and innovative invoicing.
    • If you use standard payment conditions, include them in your invoice settings so that they display on every invoice you send. You can also add your company logo and modify our invoice templates.
    • Set up a payment facility so clients may pay you right from the invoice.
    • You must examine your bank statement and Xero ledger to reconcile your account.
    • Bank feeds connect your bank to Xero. Bank feeds automatically import bank statements into Xero so you can match statement lines to transactions. It helps you track incoming and outgoing capital.
    • Add an authorised or invoiced purchase request to a new bill to pay a supplier for supplies received.
    • Xero prepares one draft bill for each supplier from copied purchase orders.
    • Configure your suppliers to make sales orders to match products and services to a job.
    • Create contacts for each supplier, search by name, address, or phone number, or filter by the supplier's first letter.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Describe the process for managing financial transactions, receipts, and accounts reconciliation
    • Outline the instructions to set up payroll, monthly wages, and posting the monthly journal
    • Recognise the process for filling out the VAT and CIS return
    • Summarise how to manage accrual, prepayments, and deferred income in Xero

  • Lesson Summary

    • Xero records transactions, such as invoices, bills, cost claims, or monetary transactions.
    • Add a "receive money" action to track customers or deposit cash in Xero. This action is for money, checks, or electronic deposits in a Xero bank account unrelated to an invoice, transfer, or refund.
    • Bank reconciliation ensures that all transactions in your bank accounts are controlled and recorded in your business's financial records.
    • By comparing the bank statement lines from your bank account on the left with the transactions in Xero on the right, you may reconcile your account in Xero by going to the Reconcile tab.
    • Statement lines are bank transactions imported through bank feeds or manually. In online banking, they're bank transactions; in Xero, they're bank statement lines.
    • Xero automatically generates a list of account transactions to match the statement line. All the information on the statement line is then manually compared to the account transaction. And the transaction most comparable to the bank statement line is suggested if numerous transactions match; Xero checks for the closest due date.
    • Xero has Payroll, leave, timesheet, and superannuation tools. Click the organisation's name, Settings, and Payroll to access payroll options. Click Bank Account from the Organization menu and select the account from which to pay employees. Use the default accounts for earnings, PAYG, and superannuation, or choose another.

    • By comparing the bank statement lines from your bank account on the left with the transactions in Xero on the right, you may reconcile your account in Xero by going to the Reconcile tab.

    • Xero automatically generates a list of account transactions to match the statement line. All the information on the statement line is then manually compared to the account transaction. And the transaction most comparable to the bank statement line is suggested if numerous transactions match; Xero checks for the closest due date.
    • Xero has Payroll, leave, timesheet, and superannuation tools. Click the organisation's name, Settings, and Payroll to access payroll options. Click Bank Account from the Organization menu and select the account from which to pay employees. Use the default accounts for earnings, PAYG, and superannuation, or choose another.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • After taking this module, you will be prepared to:
    • Discuss the capabilities for depreciation, report management, and budgeting in Xero
    • Explain the process for preparing the cash flow, adding payment services, and bank rules
    • Recognise the procedure for adding multiple currencies
    • Summarise the available features for correcting an error in Xero

  • Lesson Summary

    • Depreciation: To run a depreciation report in Xero, choose Accounting, Advanced, and Fixed assets.Then, select the option to "Run Depreciation." Pick the date you want depreciation to start accruing from.. Review depreciation, then click Confirm.
    • Budgeting: With Xero's Budget Manager, you can easily prepare budgets and then compare those estimates to actual performance.
    • Management Reports: The management's report section provides an executive summary, cash summary, profit-and-loss, income statement, aged receivables summary, and aged account payable summary.
    • Bank rules spare you from constantly creating a fresh transaction every moment you get a repeating or similar bank statement line. You instruct Xero how to code statement lines so it can recommend the proper transaction and fill in some details.
    • Payments: Include a "receive money" transaction to note cash you've collected from a customer or that you want to deposit. This option is for cash, check, or electronic deposits in a Xero bank account that are unrelated to a bill, transfer, or refund.
    • When using Xero, petty cash should be tracked through a bank account rather than as a current asset. This action enables Xero's spend money operations and inter-bank transfers. Consult your accountant or bookkeeper if you're unsure how to manage petty cash.
    • Choose "Advanced" in the Accounting drop-down box for additional customization options. Tap the star, followed by the options for your accounting menu that you would like to include.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Budgeting: With Xero's Budget Manager, you can easily prepare budgets and then compare those estimates to actual performance.
    • Management Reports: The management's report section provides an executive summary, cash summary, profit-and-loss, income statement, aged receivables summary, and aged account payable summary.
    • Bank rules spare you from constantly creating a fresh transaction every moment you get a repeating or similar bank statement line. You instruct Xero how to code statement lines so it can recommend the proper transaction and fill in some details.
    • Payments: Include a "receive money" transaction to note cash you've collected from a customer or that you want to deposit. This option is for cash, check, or electronic deposits in a Xero bank account that are unrelated to a bill, transfer, or refund.
    • When using Xero, petty cash should be tracked through a bank account rather than as a current asset. This action enables Xero's spend money operations and inter-bank transfers. Consult your accountant or bookkeeper if you're unsure how to manage petty cash.
    • Choose "Advanced" in the Accounting drop-down box for additional customization options. Tap the star, followed by the options for your accounting menu that you would like to include.
